description: VRoid Studio allows you to create a 3D avatar and export it in the VRM format, for use with VR programs that support the VRM 3D avatar standard. These avatars typically look like anime characters with stylized hair and clothes.

Natively, VRoid Studio saves users' avatars as VROID files. You can open a VROID file in VRoid Studio to edit the avatar it contains. (You cannot open VRM files in VRoid Studio.) By default, VRoid Studio saves users' VROID files in the following directory:
